avalancheActivity.highlights: Ongoing SW snowshowers and strong winds have created windslabs widely in NW-SE facing hills. Strong N wind on Tuesday and windslabs may have formed in south facing aspects. Older snow is considered rather stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: SW winds and snowshowers dominated last week. It got warm high in the mountains with rain early on Friday and snow melted and subsided widely then more snow was added in SW wind. Strong N wind on Tuesday and windslabs may have formed in south facing aspects. A snowprofile was taken in Bláfjöll the 5th of Feb. in a NW facing aspect, revealing cold windbroken snow on top of hardpacked isothermal snow. An ice layer was between the isothermal snow and the cold windbroken snow. A rather high temperature gradient was in the top layers. Stability test showed no response.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers last week and resently N-erly snowfall or snowshowers this week. Unstable windslabs can occure in different aspects, espesially in lows and gullies.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers and recently after NW-NE snowshowers.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðlægar eða hægbreytilegar áttir og bjartviðri í vikunni. Áframhaldandi frost.

avalancheActivity.comment: Two avalanches released in Súðavíkurhlíð on Tuesday 6.2., one of them ran over the road. Two avalanches fell on and right by the road Súðavíkurhlíð early on Saturday 3.2. Avalanches also fell in Súðavíkurhlíð on the evening of 30th of Jan and night before 1st of Feb.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New wind slabs should be expected in southerly aspects after snowfall in NW-NE winds on Tuesday. They may be unstable. Before, wind slabs had formed in leesides from NE and SW winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow thawed up to 600m height last week. On top, new wind slabs have formed, first in SW winds, then NE and finally NW-NE winds and snowfall on Tuesday. Layered wind slabs can therefore be expected in most aspects. They may be unstable, especially the most recent snow. There is though still rather little snow in mountains for the season and if avalanches release, they are not expected to be very large.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers last week and resently N-erly snowfall or snowshowers this week. Unstable windslabs can occure in different aspects, espesially in lows and gullies.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers and recently after NW-NE snowshowers.

weatherForecast.highlights: Smá él í NA átt á miðvikudagsmorgun, styttir svo upp, lægir og kólnar heldur. Úrkomulítið og hægur vindur í framhaldinu.

avalancheActivity.comment: A slab avalanche fell over the road Ólafsfjarðarvegur on Tuesday afternoon, 6.2. Earlier the same morning, an avalanche released in Ólafsfjarðarmúli, but it was smaller and stopped above the road. A few slab avalanches were recorded early last weekend in various aspects, above Ólafsfjarðarvegur, in Dýjadalur, Tungudalur and Burstabrekkudalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: On Tuesday, a lot of snow was added and drifted in NW-NE winds. Wind slabs are in various aspects, the newest ones in southerly. They can be unstable, especially the newest snow.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Recently, snow has been added and drifted, in SW winds last week and then NW-NE winds in the recent days. Layered wind slabs are expected in most aspects. A few slab avalanches released early last weekend, in various aspects. Since then, much snow has been added and transported in northerly winds. The wind slabs can be unstable, especially the newest slabs which are generally in southerly aspects. With cooling temperatures after the precipitation ends on Wednesday, weak layers might evolve over time due to a high temperature gradient in the snow.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers last week and resently N-erly snowfall or snowshowers this week. Unstable windslabs can occure in different aspects, espesially in lows and gullies.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers and recently after NW-NE snowshowers.

weatherForecast.highlights: Smá él í NA átt á miðvikudagsmorgun, styttir svo upp, lægir og kólnar heldur. Úrkomulítið og hægur vindur í framhaldinu.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs high in mountains but old stable snow in lower part of mountains. Snow will be added in mountains in NW then N wind and windslabs can form in easterly and southerly aspect, especially in gullies and lows.

snowpackStructure.highlights: High in mountains there is dry recent snow that has formed windslabs. In lower part of mountains snow has subsided and melted and is considered stable. Snow will be added in mountains in NW then N wind on Tuesday and Wednesday, and windslabs can form in easterly and southerly aspect, especially in gullies and lows.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers last week and resently N-erly snowfall or snowshowers this week. Unstable windslabs can occure in different aspects, espesially in lows and gullies.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers and recently after NW-NE snowshowers.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðlæg átt og dálítil él á miðvikudag, norðvestlæg átt og bjart á fimmtudag.
